trans-unit.source: Working with Suspicious Activities | Microsoft ATA
trans-unit.target: Working with Suspicious Activities | Microsoft ATA

trans-unit.source: Describes how to review suspicious activities identified by ATA
trans-unit.target: Describes how to review suspicious activities identified by ATA

trans-unit.source: Applies to: Advanced Threat Analytics version 1.7
trans-unit.target: Applies to: Advanced Threat Analytics version 1.7

trans-unit.source: Working with Suspicious Activities
trans-unit.target: Working with Suspicious Activities

trans-unit.source: This topic explains the basics of how to work with Advanced Threat Analytics.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains the basics of how to work with Advanced Threat Analytics.

trans-unit.source: Review suspicious activities on the attack time line
trans-unit.target: Review suspicious activities on the attack time line

trans-unit.source: After logging in to the ATA Console, you are automatically taken to the open **Suspicious Activities Time Line**.
trans-unit.target: After logging in to the ATA Console, you are automatically taken to the open **Suspicious Activities Time Line**.

trans-unit.source: Suspicious activities are listed in chronological order with the newest suspicious activities on the top of the time line.
trans-unit.target: Suspicious activities are listed in chronological order with the newest suspicious activities on the top of the time line.

trans-unit.source: Each suspicious activity has the following information:
trans-unit.target: Each suspicious activity has the following information:

trans-unit.source: Entities involved, including users, computers, servers, domain controllers, and resources.
trans-unit.target: Entities involved, including users, computers, servers, domain controllers, and resources.

trans-unit.source: Times and time frame of the suspicious activities.
trans-unit.target: Times and time frame of the suspicious activities.

trans-unit.source: Severity of the suspicious activity, High, Medium, or Low.
trans-unit.target: Severity of the suspicious activity, High, Medium, or Low.

trans-unit.source: Status: Open, resolved, or dismissed.
trans-unit.target: Status: Open, resolved, or dismissed.

trans-unit.source: Ability to
trans-unit.target: Ability to

trans-unit.source: Share the suspicious activity with other people in your organization via email.
trans-unit.target: Share the suspicious activity with other people in your organization via email.

trans-unit.source: Export the suspicious activity to Excel.
trans-unit.target: Export the suspicious activity to Excel.

trans-unit.source: Add a note to the suspicious activity.
trans-unit.target: Add a note to the suspicious activity.

trans-unit.source: Provide input on the suspicious activity.
trans-unit.target: Provide input on the suspicious activity.

trans-unit.source: Provides recommendations for how to respond to the suspicious activity.
trans-unit.target: Provides recommendations for how to respond to the suspicious activity.

trans-unit.source: When you hover your mouse over a user or computer, an entity mini-profile is displayed that provides additional information about the entity and includes the number of suspicious activities that the entity is linked to.
trans-unit.target: When you hover your mouse over a user or computer, an entity mini-profile is displayed that provides additional information about the entity and includes the number of suspicious activities that the entity is linked to.

trans-unit.source: If you click on an entity, it will take you to the entity profile of the user or computer.
trans-unit.target: If you click on an entity, it will take you to the entity profile of the user or computer.

trans-unit.source: ATA suspicious activities timeline image
trans-unit.target: ATA suspicious activities timeline image

trans-unit.source: Filter suspicious activities list
trans-unit.target: Filter suspicious activities list

trans-unit.source: To filter the suspicious activities list:
trans-unit.target: To filter the suspicious activities list:

trans-unit.source: In the **Filter by** pane on the left side of the screen, select one of the following: **All**, **Open**, **Resolved**, or **Dismissed**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Filter by** pane on the left side of the screen, select one of the following: **All**, **Open**, **Resolved**, or **Dismissed**.

trans-unit.source: To further filter the list, select **High**, **Medium** or **Low**.
trans-unit.target: To further filter the list, select **High**, **Medium** or **Low**.

trans-unit.source: Suspicious activity severity
trans-unit.target: Suspicious activity severity

trans-unit.source: Low
trans-unit.target: Low

trans-unit.source: Indicates suspicious activities that can lead to attacks designed for malicious users or software to gain access to organizational data.
trans-unit.target: Indicates suspicious activities that can lead to attacks designed for malicious users or software to gain access to organizational data.

trans-unit.source: Medium
trans-unit.target: Medium

trans-unit.source: Indicates suspicious activities that can put specific identities at risk for more severe attacks that could result in identity theft or privileged escalation
trans-unit.target: Indicates suspicious activities that can put specific identities at risk for more severe attacks that could result in identity theft or privileged escalation

trans-unit.source: High
trans-unit.target: High

trans-unit.source: Indicates suspicious activities that can lead to identity theft, privilege escalation or other high-impact attacks
trans-unit.target: Indicates suspicious activities that can lead to identity theft, privilege escalation or other high-impact attacks

trans-unit.source: Suspicious activity status
trans-unit.target: Suspicious activity status

trans-unit.source: Open
trans-unit.target: Open

trans-unit.source: All new suspicious activities appear in this list
trans-unit.target: All new suspicious activities appear in this list

trans-unit.source: Resolved
trans-unit.target: Resolved

trans-unit.source: Is used to track suspicious activities which you identified, researched and fixed for mitigated.
trans-unit.target: Is used to track suspicious activities which you identified, researched and fixed for mitigated.

trans-unit.source: ATA may reopen a resolved activity if it the same activity is detected again within a short period of time.
trans-unit.target: ATA may reopen a resolved activity if it the same activity is detected again within a short period of time.

trans-unit.source: Dismissed
trans-unit.target: Dismissed

trans-unit.source: Are activities that you manually dismissed.
trans-unit.target: Are activities that you manually dismissed.

trans-unit.source: If ATA detects a similar suspicious activity a new detection will be created.
trans-unit.target: If ATA detects a similar suspicious activity a new detection will be created.

trans-unit.source: Provide input on a suspicious activity
trans-unit.target: Provide input on a suspicious activity

trans-unit.source: To enable ATA to learn about your network with you, some suspicious activities (DNS reconnaissance, Pass the Ticket, SMB Session Enumeration, Abnormal Behavior and Remote Execution) request your input to will enhance the detection of suspicious activities going forward.
trans-unit.target: To enable ATA to learn about your network with you, some suspicious activities (DNS reconnaissance, Pass the Ticket, SMB Session Enumeration, Abnormal Behavior and Remote Execution) request your input to will enhance the detection of suspicious activities going forward.

trans-unit.source: For suspicious activities that enable you to provide input, the input question opens automatically.
trans-unit.target: For suspicious activities that enable you to provide input, the input question opens automatically.

trans-unit.source: You will be asked to answer questions about activities on your network and whether or not they should be considered suspicious.
trans-unit.target: You will be asked to answer questions about activities on your network and whether or not they should be considered suspicious.

trans-unit.source: In the below example, you are being asked if running scanning tools is allowed from a specific computer.
trans-unit.target: In the below example, you are being asked if running scanning tools is allowed from a specific computer.

trans-unit.source: ATA provide input for suspicious activities image
trans-unit.target: ATA provide input for suspicious activities image

trans-unit.source: If you answer no, this activity will be considered suspicious and any time ATA encounters this activity from this computer, you will be alerted.
trans-unit.target: If you answer no, this activity will be considered suspicious and any time ATA encounters this activity from this computer, you will be alerted.

trans-unit.source: However, if you answer yes, the suspicious activity may be dismissed and future activities of this type from this computer may not generate a suspicious activity or will generate an activity that is automatically dismissed.
trans-unit.target: However, if you answer yes, the suspicious activity may be dismissed and future activities of this type from this computer may not generate a suspicious activity or will generate an activity that is automatically dismissed.

trans-unit.source: If you do not know, you can click **Cancel**.
trans-unit.target: If you do not know, you can click **Cancel**.

trans-unit.source: Change the status of a suspicious activity
trans-unit.target: Change the status of a suspicious activity

trans-unit.source: You can change the status of a suspicious activity by clicking the current status of the suspicious activity and selecting one of the following **Open**, **Resolved** or **Dismissed**.
trans-unit.target: You can change the status of a suspicious activity by clicking the current status of the suspicious activity and selecting one of the following **Open**, **Resolved** or **Dismissed**.

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.target: Check out the ATA forum!
